job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: JOB DESCRIPTION Site Reliability Engineer: As an Engineer in the Retail and Athlete Tools team, you will be passionate about maximum availability, observability, reliability, security, and performance of Client’s Digital Experiences in Stores and in our Digital call centers around the globe! You will build applications, tools, and automation using your technical skills to provide deep problem analysis, detect system faults or code defects, define, report, write and build observability processes for critical metrics, and partner up with product delivery teams to provide long term scalable solutions to production issues! We are looking for hardworking engineers who can bring the following: Ability to observe, diagnose, code, and test fixes for production issues quickly and efficiently Ability to develop and drive real-time supervising solutions that provide transparency into site health and key performance indicators Strong communication skills are written and verbal with the ability to articulate issues and their impact(s), write concise runbooks, and give technical demo’s Capable of reporting and communicating metrics with an understanding of the business landscape and how site reliability influences our consumers Working understanding of IT service management (Incident, Problem, Change and Knowledge management) Ability to work across teams (business and technical) to continuously analyze system performance, seek for avoidance/root-cause, and proactively identify areas in need of optimization Passion for continuous learning, partnership, and teamwork Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or another relevant subject area 1-2 years of professional experience in software development, testing, and/or DevOps engineering. Career: Design and development experience with microservice-based architecture in Java, Node.js, or similar language preferred Design and development experience with front-end UI languages such as Javascript, React, Swift, or similar preferred Experience building, deploying, and supporting cloud-based systems in AWS preferred Experience with at least one database layer such as SQL, DynamoDb, Cassandra, etc. Understanding of basic network and infrastructure concepts such as DNS, Virtualization, Linux Experience with Docker and/or Serverless patterns a plus Experience with observability monitoring tools such as Splunk, SignalFx, New Relic, or Catchpoint is a plus Background with ITIL or Lean a plus.
